synopsis.text:
Though born as an illegitimate son of the emperor, Hikaru Genji navigates the opulent Heian period with charm and elegance, serving as a government official amidst the Kyoto nobility. Renowned for his captivating good looks, he finds himself entangled in a web of romantic affairs and scandalous liaisons. However, Genji's heart yearns for an unattainable desire: his father's enchanting bride.

As he chases after this forbidden love, he sets off a chain of tragic consequences, driving him to wander from one romantic conquest to another. Despite the endless attention from the ladies of the court, Genji remains unfulfilled, seeking a sense of completion in his life. With every new affair, he hopes to find the love he truly desires, but will he ever succeed?

"The Tale of Genji" is an adaptation of the groundbreaking 11th-century novel penned by Murasaki Shikibu, widely regarded as the first Japanese novel. Follow Genji's passionate journey through romance, heartbreak, and the complexities of love in this timeless classic.
